title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The response must be a definite integral with correct lower and upper limits to earn this point.

Because | A( t ) |=A( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@49F8@ for 1≤t≤5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F89@ a response of ∫ 1 5 |  450 sin( 0.62t )   |dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4EFF@ or ∫ 1 5 | A( t ) |dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@499E@ earns the point.

A response missing dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGKbGaamiDaaaa@3ADE@ or using dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGKbGaamiEaaaa@3AE2@ is eligible to earn the point.

A response with a copy error in the expression for A ( t ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DD5@ will earn the point only in the presence of ∫ 1 5 A ( t )dt . MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4416@

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The use of the average value formula, indicating that a=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGHbGaeyypa0JaaGymaaaa@3BA3@ and b=5, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGIbGaeyypa0JaaGynaiaacYcaaaa@3C58@ can be presented in single or multiple steps to earn the first point. For example, the following response earns both points: ∫ 1 5 A( t )dt =1502.147865, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@51B9@ so the average value is 375.536966. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@413C@

A response that presents a correct integral along with the correct average value, but provides incorrect or incomplete communication, earns 1 out of 2 points. For example, the following response earns 1 out of 2 points: ∫ 1 5 A( t )dt =1502.147865=375.536966. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5885@ so the average value is 375.536966. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@413C@

The answer must be correct to three decimal places. For example, 1 5−1 ∫ 1 5 A( t )dt =375.536966≈376 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@560F@ earns only the first point.

Degree mode: A response that presents answers obtained by using a calculator in degree mode does not earn the first point it would have otherwise earned. The response is generally eligible for all subsequent points (unless no answer is possible in degree mode or the question is made simpler by using degree mode). In degree mode, 1 4 ∫ 1 5 A( t )dt =79.416068. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4F58@

Special case: 1 5 ∫ 1 5 A ( t )dt =300.429573 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DCE@ earns 1 out of 2 points.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The response need not present the value of A ′ ( 1 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E54@ The second line of the model solution earns both points.

An incorrect value assigned to A ′ ( 1 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E54@ earns the first point (but will not earn the second point).

Without a reference to t=1, MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaacYcaaaa@3C66@ the first point is earned by any of the following:

· 148.947 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3E4A@ accurate to the number of decimals presented, with zero up to three decimal places (i.e., 149, 148,148.9,148.95, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5654@ or 148.94 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D89@ )

· A ′ ( t )=148.947 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4455@ by itself

To be eligible for the second point, the first point must be earned.

To earn the second point, there must be a reference to t=1 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaaaa@3BB6@ .

Degree mode: A ′ ( 1 )=23.404311 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@459B@

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

It is not necessary to indicate that A( t )=400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@410D@ to earn the first point, although this statement alone would earn the first point.

A response of “ A( t )≥400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407B@ when 1.469372≤t≤3.597713 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4952@ ” will earn the first 2 points. A response of “ A( t )≥400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407B@ ” along with the presence of exactly one of the two numbers above will earn the first point, but not the second. A response of “ A( t )≥400 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@407B@ ” by itself will not earn either of the first 2 points.

To earn the second point the values for a and b must be accurate to the number of decimals presented, with at least one and up to three decimal places. These may appear only in a candidates table, as limits of integration, or on a number line.

A response with incorrect notation involving t or x is eligible to earn all 4 points.

A response that does not earn the first point is still eligible for the remaining 3 points.

To earn the third point, a response must present the greatest number of vehicles. This point is earned for answers of either 71 or 71.254 *** MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44C2@ only.

A correct justification earns the fourth point, even if the third point is not earned because of a decimal presentation error.

When using a Candidates Test, the response must include the values for N ( a ),  N( b ), MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48A4@ and N( 4 ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DA7@ to earn the fourth point. These values must be correct to the number of decimals presented, with up to three decimal places. (Correctly rounded integer values are acceptable.)

Alternate solution for the third and fourth points:

For a≤t≤b,A ( t )≥400. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E00@ For b≤t≤4,A ( t )≤400. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4DC7@

Thus, N( t )= ∫ a t ( A( x )−400 )dx MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5171@ is greatest at t=b. MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaamOyaiaac6caaaa@3C94@

N( b )=71.254129, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4627@ and the greatest number of vehicles in line is 71.

Degree mode: The response is only eligible to earn the first point because in degree mode A( t )<400. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@402C@
